text:
Well what can i say? It's a cheap , clean place...

The food was so so it actually depend of what you eat... Do not try the bbq beef if you don't want to run to the restroom that's for sure lol...

everything else was okay... but i wouldn't go back

Jumbo Buffet is one of those off the radar cheap Asian buffet most tourists coming to LV will never find out or experience! I did saw an ad they posted decades ago. Back then I didn't give them much thought since the strip already has so many great choice to offer. Forward ten yrs later! Since moving to LV recently n saw their ad in a local Filipino newspaper! I was kind of skeptical at first but did give them credit for still in operation after all these yrs! So I took a leap of faith I went on a Tuesday evening. The place was kind of rundown like most Asian establishment n the host or owner was kind of rude or frigid! He didn't show me to the dining table until I acknowledge for a one. The waiter was very nice n did fill my drink n clear my plates really quick. But his English was very minimum. 
            About the food! It is your average basic Asian flair! There r a few stand out items I did quite enjoy n so did other patrons. They r Korean Kalbi ribs, dried-fried salt n pepper chicken wings n the salt n pepper stir-fried shrimps. Some people did rave about their steam fish heads. But I m not the type of person that can eat somethin so exotic.
             Anyway! If u r on a budget n want to eat something different n r tire of the long lines n outrageous price the buffets on the strip r charging.
With an open mind n an adventure to traverse outside the glamour n glitz of the strip. U will be suprise LV has so much more to offer!

not much Chinese food to choose from, lots of jello,  thawed desserts,etc.. ..the tiny crab looked like it was just born, legs were about an inch long..vit the food was so yucky, maybe that was a blessing...,  was hot, humid, "grimey" feeling, floors were sticky, like dirty mop water, and there was a mop bucket with slimey water against the wall, the bathrooms were disgusting, literally piss all over the toilets,  and they were clogged...  we had 15 family members that had to catch a flight, so no time to load everyone back up and look for somewhere else .. DISGUSTING FOOD...

911 NEED TO REACH OWNER--------------

Horrible experience. I'm from out of town so I called to see closing time. Manager Erika said 9pm they close door but failed to mention they also stop serving at 9pm. Got there about 845pm and they were taking forever to bring food out. When they did it was loud and messy. My 5yr old niece slipped because floor was moped but no caution sign was up. Erika did not apologize to my niece. Her assistant manager laughed at me and then raised his hands up. I could've engaged physically w him but rather I wanted to speak to the owner. I asked what his name was "BEN". It seems Erika gave me BENS name as owner and cell phone so they're just giving me the run around. 
*IF ANYONE KNOWS ANYTHING ABOUT HOW I CAN REACH OWNER PLEASE LET ME KNOW* 
I've already filed complaint w health services on their poor food preparation.
Food was nasty.  Unbelievable this time in age food could be like this.  Most the food I tasted, I hid to spit out.
DIRTY place!!!! from the parking lot, the entry doors, windows, walls, food looks old, and the smell that comes out from the bathrooms, just nasty! $5.99 will not cover my ER bill!
Had lunch while visiting Spring Preserve. Good selection. Authentic Chinese. Kids like the selection. Good value for price. Chicken well done here.
The food is crap...but it's sooooo cheap!  So cheap, I can't afford NOT to eat here!
This place is garbage staff is rude and the food was terrible the crab legs had a bad smell to them this isn't Chinese food go  to krazy buffet for good food or any  where else garbage

This lace kind of centered in town is OK, not the greatest but the price os good and for the most part the waiters seem to come around alot compared to other places.
For lunch its acceptable.

It wasn't all that bad. Some forget that they're only paying $7, but complain like they gave $100. You can save tons of money by eating there if you're  too lazy to make your own food. But if you're rich enough to afford for some fancy buffet, than don't waste your time paying $7 than complaining that the cherry was missing from the top of the ice cream. Actually i made a plan that i'm gonna eat there every day,it will cost me $300 a month,definitely worth the price eating variety of food till i'm fed up...

I live down the street from Super Jumbo, with several asian buffets in the area - and this is my favorite since it opened.

The food is good and wide ranging  My favorite is the fried plantains and stuffed shrimp. The price is right, the service is good. I normally dont hit any particular buffet more than a few times because I have so many choices in the area as well as Las Vegas. 

Of course, this being a buffet, the food isnt going to be not great after being out in hot trays for awhile, but go before 7pm.

The weak spot in the food are the deserts - except for the fresh fruit, I would avoid it, including the frozen ..."ice cream".

My way of rating a Vegas buffet is "will I go back?". I keep going back. 30 times at last count.

One star because you cant give zero! There were so many clues, but I ignored all of them. I'm not super picky when it comes to Chinese buffets, especially super cheap buffets. I'm a big kid. I know what I'm getting into. Or at least I thought so. I had a bad feeling when I walked in. I even asked to take a look before I decided to try it. It all looked good for the most part., but it's like that bunny from Monty Python and the Holy Grail; it looked good and harmless, but inside lurked an awful, ugly, vile monster.

I couldn't even finish my first plate. It was all so very very bad. Go there at you own risk!
The food here is way below par.about the only edible things are the hot and sour soup and fried rice. Go another half mile south to Padma express
The food here is good...I love the crab rangoons.  The only thing that could be better is the chow mein. The service is great the servers are very attentive and nice.

Extremely dirty! Did not look like the floors had ever been mopped and tables were dirty. The carpets were black and greasy. Could not use the bathroom at all because there were feces on floor and toilets. Completely grossed out!

Just took the fam here for dinner. Worst mistake ever.DO NOT eat here. Place is dirty. Bathroom will make you gag.Now let's talk about the food. The foods were cold let alone didn't really taste all that great. Most of the food trays were also empty.Had to wait for like 5 minutes to get freshly cook food and it disappears in like seconds because people are in line to get food.

In my opinion,  this is by far the worst buffet I've ever been to.  The food is atrocious!  Lacks flavor like you wouldn't believe.   The employees are beyond rude.  This is my first and last visit here!  

Every option of food in here , is beyond disgusting!!  The only reason this place exists is because it is inexpensive.  

Do yourself a favor, and never ever come here!!

I'll try to keep this review short and to-the-point. If you think you'll get more bang for your buck hitting up this buffet for lunch/dinner instead of swinging by the old fast food drive thru... I'd highly suggest going that route.

Compared to other smaller branch Asian buffets, this place has to be a bust. Limited selection, displeasing displays, old-timey decor & not the best service. If you don't like to be bothered during your meal, or would like to dehydrate from having no refills rather, this place is he place to go. My family & I have gone here as the cheap alternative when we can't think of a place to eat & are in the area. We've been coming here for many years & sad to say the food & quality have not changed.

Please save your coin & your time & just order from the McD's dollar menu. You'll be more satisfied.

If you are looking for a good Asian buffet... don't go here. Everything was dried up from the rice to the bloody chicken. I tried the barbecue chicken on a skewer and when taking a bite it was like trying to rip off a piece of rubber with my teeth. I spent the rest of my day frequently using the restroom.
Food was semi ok and they didn't refresh the trays of food as often as they should've but I guess for the cheap price that's the quality you get
Large selection of food (including seafood), Great price ($5.55 for dinner), Good location/signage--Easy Access, Ample parking.

My friends, wife and I ate here 2 days ago. The night of the buffet and the following day, 3 of them had stomach problems.  I ate a limited menu so, luckily, I was not affected.

The food here was so bad. There must have only been one cook because the refills were very slow in coming.  The dim sum entries were empty for at least 35 minutes before they were refilled. It could have been longer since they were empty when we got there.   Many of the dishes were very salty and tasted funny.

I know the price for lunch was only 5.99 plus drink and tip, but maybe they should charge more and provide better quality food and quicker food replacement.  I really don't understand the glowing comments by others here.  Maybe they were at a different buffet.  I would definitely recommend Buffet Asia on Sahara and Rainbow, or Krazy Buffet on Cheyenne and Rainbow as much better buffets.

This is probably the worst Chinese buffet I have ever gone to. The only saving graces of this place are the large selection of dim food and the cheap price...only 8.99 all day, weekend or weekday. However, most of the dishes are either overcooked or undercooked and the sushi is terrible. The worst part of it is the fact that my whole family got food poisoning after eating here....we just had a few crab legs and ended up vomiting the entire next day. What a way to ruin a vacation...I recommend going to a better chinese buffet like Pacific buffet just down the road.

My girlfriend and I stopped in to have a quick dinner at a new place. We had no expectations whatsoever but had seem mediocre reviews. Honestly I thought the food was delicious, very well prepared. The fish heads were great, my girlfriend liked the crab legs, and their Asian specialty cuisines were quite excellent.

let's be fair, less than $6 buffet,  have streamed salmon, shrimp, like their jalapeno chicken, and tofu, nothing really stands out, but no wait, and the price is right.  some of the selections I don't see it from China Star.  the server does do a good job cleaning up and getting the bills.
They good was so gross. Nasty tasting. I began to vomit after only a few bits. The manager made us pay even after complaining. It was just bad.

If you wanna loose weigth or loose a week fromnyour work place this is the rigth place to get sick. Horrible conditions in restrooms. Food looks awfull. The cups dont seem properly clean.Unfortunally we had paid before we get to see the food trays. If you love yourself, dont go here.

I stopped here today. Restaurant was CLOSED. The door was tied together with a old necktie and nobody inside.
When open I would give the food 3 stars. It's a buffet so some dishes are better than others. Ambience I would give 1 star. It looks to be last renovated back in the 80s and little attention to appearance after that.

How is this a running restaurant? They had a wide varitey of food but the restaurant was a complete mess. Paint chipped, dirty walls, dirty ripped carpet and  dust everywhere. The food was ok. I only stuck to the beef broccoli and egg drop soup. There were small black things in the soup which looked like teflon from a pan. I took a small bite of some chicken and it was old and brown. Don't come here when you vegas. Go hit the strip!! The health department needs to shut this unhealthy place down

It supposed to be cheap and quick. My fish heads were tender and well seasoned. Service was courteous and prompt. Quit your hating' on the place. People are really too hard on this place in these reviews. It's not Ping Pang Pong or somewhere. But the food is good and the soups were very good. I'll go back for sure.

You haven't lived until you've dined at Jumbo Super Buffet!!! Come on now it has the words Jumbo and Super in the name and it's a buffet. FTW!!! 

Really though it's just another cheap Asian buffet.  You almost always get what you pay for at a cheap Asian buffet, which is not the greatest quality food but will get everyone feed for cheap. I've had more than my share of cheap Asian buffets and Jumbo probably isn't my preferred choice. It's alright.. I've been here like only once, the folks though at least once a month for however many years we've known of this buffet, they enjoy this place a little too much.

So the dining area is spacious, it can hold a lot of people, I wouldn't be surprised if they bussed people from a tour into here. They have lots of items your usual beef broccoli, ham, salmon, sushi, fried chicken, and even dim sum. There really wasn't a lot of beef or pork dishes, at least when I was there. I kind of left protein deficient, like beef and pork deficient. I was starving but not really.  Don't know how to explain it but I'm sure others know what I mean. I liked the shrimps, the calamari, and the mushrooms. Didn't like the crab. A number of items I didn't try because of the way they looked.

The dim sum was surprisingly really good. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jumbo-super-buffet-las-vegas?select=ZFKaJJiEqJ83EIzsyFO1Pw#sk4h1rKqTLrCfBKx36ldsw not a lot to pick from but everything I enjoyed too bad they were more like desserts. The pork hash, the custard thing, and the brownish yellow thing in the pic was my favorites, had to have it a few times.

The customer service wasn't that bad. They seem to be always cleaning and refilling food that were low. They were friendly. 

A cheap Asian buffet maybe I'll be back, maybe.

I went here for the first time about 2 weeks ago, starving looking for something out of the ordinary burger joint. Along came Jumbo buffet. Thought I might give it a try even though the outside looks a little deterrent. But I came in and was greeted very nicely. Food was excellent compared to the buffets in north town or east Las Vegas. Besides, where can you eat as many chicken wings and fried shrimps for under 6$ (not including drink and tip)? Next time I'm bringing in my own scampi sauce... yeah buddy!!

I enjoy going here when I don't feel like spending a whole lot of money and just want to have a reasonably good amount of food. It's not a fine dining buffet, but the coconut flavor chicken isn't too bad along with a crab dish mixed with vegetables and cheese.  it's about $8 for lunch, can't beat that price these days with $30 buffets on the strip.

One of the worst buffets I have ever been to. I feel bad taking my kids here. There are a lot of 3 and 4 star ratings,  these people must be on crack or are related to the owners. I nearly puked when I went into the restroom. More graffiti than on the streets of LA. Should be no stars but I am forced to choose in order to post.

Not as bad as most of the reviews say , especial considering the price ,IMHO. $6.99 and you get way healthier options and more serving than any of the fast food meal you can order out there .  Fresh fruit , hot soup, chicken , beef, fish, veggies, snack...no food poisoning , been there a few times now.

A touch above the average Asian buffet around town. Well lit, a good selection of food, fresh made California rolls, the egg rolls are great, as are the glass noodles. They have pizza, chicken nuggets, wings, fried chicken, garlic bread, French fries and, onion rings for those who want a little variety from the strictly Asian fair. There is a selection of cut fruits and veggies as well as the desert bar with ice cream, too.  While dining 5:30 to 6pm on a Sunday, they were regularly bringing out fresh trays of food as the others emptied. The large butterflied shrimp were great too.

Bad food! The worst I ever had! Even though it's a buffet so you can choose your food, everything was dry and gross. Food looks and tastes like it's from yesterday.. or a week ago. Cheap for a reason, big mistake.

For cheap Chinese buffet go here! Decent chicken wings, soups are good, noodles and beef broccoli is good, pizza is fresh, affordable for a family, weekday dinner 7$ adult kids were 5$ good on refills for drinks and restaurant clean, the bathrooms are a Nono very dirty.

Ate here a while back and got sick. Decent selection of food and usually many unfilled tables/booths, so feel free to choose wherever you want to sit. Food isn't all that great, but for around $7, you don't have much to lose, other than the possibility of getting sick. Stuffed crab and ribs were my favorite.

The inside is very dark and dull looking. Also somewhat gloomy.

Great place to eat if you like yesterday's food, stale bread, sour pudding , reheated pizza, and water dripping through your ice cream

The Decour is 1980's repaint with touches of grease and grime on the wall. The bathrooms are updated with recent graffiti and broken tile

Perfect for the medical intern that wants to study effects of diarrhea

Cons: 1) no much option of hot tea, only black tea; 2) not all food is looks fresh I guess because we came too late at 8 pm; 3) the guy didn't know the password from wi-fi; 4) sushi was too big; 5) no big choice of desserts.

Pros: 1) super cheap; 2) nice stuff.
Weekends are probably best the food stays freshly changed I notice. I would come here once a month Max. Cheap convenient and the food taste cheap

M-F it is $7.99 plus beverage plus tax plus (as with any restaurant) the semi optional  tip because they bring your bill to the table. The prices are posted clearly and there are not a lot of options that you have to choose between which I think was good. Not too many people when I was there, it felt almost deserted. Food was good and there is sushi and icecream! Service was VERY friendly and polite! The premises are old and tacky as I expected, but clean. The plates and the knife and spoon are super lightweight, which is not a real problem except it adds to a cheap feeling so it is not the type of place you would want to bring a date to.
Horror Chinese food.   Ghetto style.  All mid-cut chicken wings and pork ribs.  Never again!!!  Only as a joke you bring friends here.

I am sad to have to give this review. I'm a huge fan of buffet's and this one is just really run down, it needs to be remodeled, new management, new foods and maybe even just shut down. The bathroom smells like urine imbedded into the structure and we could smell it all the way out to our table. The food is old and seems to have been re-cooked and/or re-heated the next day as left-overs. The sweet & sour chicken is not deep fried chicken bits, it's frozen nuggets from Costco, and the sauce tastes like its from a frozen pouch of syrup. I don't know who hey think they're fooling in there but it was absurd how much they charge for frozen Costco food I could have cooked at home. Everything was YUK. Not fresh, not authentic, it was garbage and my entire family left feeling sick to our stomachs and ended up on the toilet all evening. Never again.

This is probably the most sketchiest buffet I've ever been to. I was told it's $6 so hey why not try it?

When you walk in you can already see how dirty this place is. Not a good first impression. 

Now the food. I'll give it to this place for having a decent variety in food but it looks and tastes like it's been sitting there all day. The rice, meats, and some seafood were hard and dry. The wet food items were sticky and smelled funny. 

The best things in this buffet are the ribs, chicken wings, and the egg drop soup. Their best is decent. 

Their soft served ice cream didn't even taste good. All I tasted was wet sugar. 

I'd only come here if I was insanely starving and only had $6.
Dirty, dirty, dirty. The health department should close this place down. My shoes were sticking to the floor.  Worst food ever too! Save your money.

One week later and I am STILL having stomach problems from this place....flavorless, cold, gummy food. The health department definitely has to check this place out. 

P.S. Watched the guy making so-called "sushi" put ketchup all over a roll. Gross.

Chinese buffet at a very low price= solid 3 stars. No, the food isn't always super hot and well-stocked.. But they do bring out new food very often. I've been here a few times and have never had an issue with there not being food available. Service is pretty good. They take plates away and refill drinks a lot. 

Food is okay. There is a good selection of typical Chinese favorites like fried rice and wontons. FYI, The sweet and sour chicken is chicken nuggets so probably not what you would expect. The fried rice, crab rangoon, and spicy chicken are some of my highlights. For the price ($6.49 M-F), I can overlook the other less than stellar food items

I would have rated a zero if I could. Walked in, food look like yesterday's garbage. Selection was minimal, we walk right back out and got charged for the drinks that we didn't even drink. Definately will not be going back at all.

Terrible!! Food is terrible,places is old and dirty, and it smells bad!! I am never going again and I left after I had just two bites. Money wasted. You are better off going to Panda Express or just buy some Jack in the Box. Stay away from this place.
Nasty food n restaurant smells like sewer couldn't finish my food gross I won't recommend at all

The taste is bad. The toilet is dirty. 
The worst thing is the manager is a ruffian. We came here with a tour bus. My 76-year elderly lady paid for both of us with cash of $24 totally. They took our cash without giving any receipt. 

Since there was no service for water, the elderly lady was walking around to get hot water herself. One guy (manager-like) asked her if she paid. She said yes. Then he said if she was coming from backdoor and insisted saying she did not pay. She said what is the evidence. During the argument, the guy told the elderly lady if she is not elderly, he will kick her to death. We wanted to call 911 but my phone was out of battery. The guy was very rude. He thought here is China so he can bully anyone he wanted.

Good but not GREAT. BUT for the price that DO have an excellent selection and a wide variety of food. Tourist buses with Asians go there and the food is authentic. Everything is fresh and tasteful and safe (Servisafe monitored). WIDE selections including salads, sushi, desserts and dim sum. Table service always seems to be slow for drinks etc. You pay when you exit.

I drove by this place the other day and saw this "$5.55 ALL DAY" sign outside.  We decided to give this place a try a couple of days ago.  For $5.55  a person and over 50 items (incl. dim sum, seafoods), where else in Vegas you can find a deal like this. We got there around 6:30pm and there were quite a bit of people eating inside.  I can't say that food was very tasty but it was not bad.  The price is right.  Definitely will come back if I am hungry and in a hurry and don't want to spend much for a quick meal.  I give this place 3 stars.

This is the worst place I've ever eaten at. Smells in here, food looks old and dry. Chicken doesn't taste like chicken. The fruit wasn't ripe. I just feel sick to my stomach. I don't recommend this place to anyone.

I ate here and I have to say I enjoyed it.  The spice sour soup was good.  The chicken wings were good.  The  BBQ ribs were tough but were tasty.  The fried rice was good.  The fried eggplant was good.  The shrimp was good. The spicy chicken was good.  The beef  & brocolli was tasty. There was more food that I didn't try but it looked good and the ice cream machine had the coldest ice cream I've eaten.  The deserts were plentiful and varied.  The lunch came to $8.00 and if the service hadn't been very slow, I'd have rated it higher.  This was a good buffet at more than reasonable price.  I went in around 2:30pm and the place had very few customers and was quiet. I don't know what the staff was doing most of the time because I only saw them when I got tired of not getting a refill and started to go look for them, they showed up.  But again,  this place is well worth the money and you can't complain about variety of food and desert.  If I had any complaint, it would be that the carpet was in very bad shape and needed replaced or cleaned and the place could be freshened up with paint and a good cleaning.  The price of the lunch was more than reasonable.
Great section of food for the entire family. Especially the price is right. The food is like Chinese/American, or  grinds you find on a Manapua truck. Especially what we call Pork Hash. Yum..
Had one plate and half way through we found black hair in our food. We got up and left. Won't be back.

First let me start off by saying you get what you pay for 6.99 for adults Monday through Friday and 8.99  through the weekend.The sushi bar was really bad it contained old sushi, you can tell  the rice looked like paper. A lot of the food was cold, there was some good stuff. But not enough to justify the rest of what they had. After I left at was feeling a bit bad all-around. Right now as you reading this review I am sitting on the toilet and I feel just terrible if you need a stomach cleanse this buffet is the way to go.

Cheap buffet for the money. Food was ok but not great. we had a party of 9 people, which the bill came out to be under $100. If your looking for a place to save money than I would recommend it. Nothing fancy about this place. A typical cheap Chinese buffet. Pretty good selection with a good seafood selection. Will I come back. Sure! but not my first option.

Worst Chinese restaurant I've ever ate at feathers in the fried chicken and red meat egg fu young was more like egg fu cakes shrimp cakes were saturated in water. Only Chinese restaurant ive went to who does not have duck sauce. Cocktail sause was ketchup with chunks of something general toso was tasteless and soggy beff and broccoli was just broccoli. Also the shrimp crab legs were dried up and hard sweet and sour sauce was just red water minimal entrée selections waiter refilled one persons drink. I had to get up amd ask for a refill, appeared the cook just threw a bunch of stuff together and labeled it as Chinese food. The worst $22.66 ive ever spent on Chinese food for lunch in my life.

This place is the worse. It's everything I imagined for the price advertised. We were sat right next to the bathroom and I can smell the odor seeping from the bathroom. Once I used the bathroom, it was an unbearable sight. I had to hold my breath and use the ugliest stall for a record 30 seconds. The lady who was taking our order knew only 3 drinks, Coke, Sprite and water. I asked for Ginger Ale. She thought I was saying Ginger Oil. My sister asked for Root Beer, She thought beer as in alcohol, My father asked if the water was filtered, she had a puzzled face. Now for the food...
Everything looked oily, slop shop and just not right. The sauces were obviously watered down. Nothing tasted right. The utensils were stained and when I asked for a new one, instead of the bust boy/waiter getting me one, he just pointed in a direction where I can get up myself and get a new one. I'm not going to waste my breath about the desserts. If this is your budget I totally understand but this is not a place I can come back to. No Stars!!!

I have this weird obsession with trying every cheap Chinese buffet in town.  Really.  It's a bad habit to invade my body with all of this processed food and possible copious amounts of MSG.  But I keep going back for more!  Must be the hunger from my poor college days of finding the most amount of food to put down my gullet for the least amount of money.  Because who knows when my next big meal would be!  

I have been curiously been wanting to try this place for a while, after constantly passing by here on Decatur on my way to work everyday.  Finally, after trying almost every other cheap Chinese buffet in town I gave in.  And wow, what a surprise!

Now when I say surprise, I don't mean the food was beyond all comparison and it deserves multiple stars for being heavenly.  I was surprised because for it's very unassuming exterior and surrounding area (there's graffiti everywhere outside on walls and the next door building...a CLOSED restaurant) Jumbo Super Buffet was jumbo packed!  The place was full to the gills of people for lunch!

My guess is because they are running their special of all-day-dining for only $5.90 a person (M-F), drinks not included!  That is some super cheap eats!  I mean, even a combo at McDonald's runs more than that so of course you can see the appeal.  The BIG FAT banner they have going across their restaurant advertising the price probably brings in quite a bit of traffic as well.

Jumbo Super Buffet is not the prettiest of places I can tell you that much.  It reminds me of a car that's tattered a bit but still gets you where you need to go.  The decor is old, yes it is a bit dusty, the tables and chairs aren't new, and yes...the place isn't the cleanest by Martha Stewart standards.  And yet, this place is full of people.

On to the food.  If you don't have a particularty strong stomach and a non-sensitive sense of smell...THIS PLACE IS NOT FOR YOU!  If you don't like the look of unfamiliar animal parts...THIS PLACE IS NOT FOR YOU!  It is bordering on the super-ethnic!  The types of food offered by Jumbo Super Buffet surprised me the most.  It's like something you might see in an Andrew Zimmer 'Bizarre Foods' packed lunch.  Me, I don't mind these types of foods because I'm Filipino and was raised on 'weird' foods...dinuguan, bagoong, and tripe stew anyone?  But for you non-initiated types you might be taken aback a bit.

Jumbo Super Buffet of course has your typical 'Asian American' style foods to appeal to the masses:  fried rice, noodles, beef & broccoli, sweet & sour pork, orange chicken (that poor panda), fried shrimp, fried eggrolls, wonton soup, miso soup, and egg drop soup.  Then there's the food for the less Asian types:  fried chicken wings, french fries, greasy pizza and the like.  It's all there and it all tastes the same...salty but somehow satisfying.

But turn a corner and you're in some definite bizarre foods territory.  This is the first Chinese buffet I've been to here that serves:

-Chicken feet (not bad by the way)
-Pigs feet (ooh...so sticky sweet)
-Fried fish heads (meh...I've had better...head...nyuk nyuk)
-Whole steamed tilapia (not really that bizarre unless you eat fish in fillet form only)

It was crazy!  And I am glad that most folks were sopping it all up!  Talk about taking it back old school!  There were folks that had nothing but half a plate of chicken feet and hot rice on their plate...and were totally happy.  I don't eat too much of the random parts often these days but I appreciate the cultures they come from and agree that a lot of these not so common animal parts deserve some respect.  Wasting parts of an animal can't always be a good thing, right?  I enjoyed my servings of chicken feet and pigs feet with a small (squeal) of delight.  The fried fish head would have probably been better with a dipping sauce of soy sauce, vinegar, pepper, green onion, and cilantro.  

Fair warning, stay AWAY from the 'sushi' bar!  Did not look good at all!  You are better off eating some fish heads and feet, avoid that salmonella station at all costs!

Other than the extra salt content (lots of these Chinese buffets do), the only complaint I had about this buffet was there was no kim chee!  WTH?  I wanted my kim chee fried rice!  And you guys need to get rid of that big vat of tapioca pudding you put on the line...looks like a bunch of fish eyes staring at me and it freaks me out.  But on the plus side, you do have three different kinds of Jell-O!

Not the best buffet I've been to, but it exceeded my expectations by not being the worst either.  Take it for what it is folks, frugal eats for frugal wallets!  And my wallet is pretty empty after the fiasco that is Black Friday!!  Happy Holidays all!

cheap food cheap quality dirty  place.The next time you eat at JUMBO SUPER BUFFET feel there chairs and seat its so dirty oily sticky and gungky.  first of all the shrimp is over cooked and the shell is stuck to the shrimp. the pork seems overly salty. the fried fish smelled and tasted old like 1 or 2 days old. very very oily food to much salt to cover the old. also watch when the servers sweep the floors and when they get someone a drink they dont ever wash there hands so your cup has all that dirty broom crap all over your cup and your mouth/lips touches that dirty ass cup watch next time and use a straw or your lips will be sorry. IF YOU REALLY NEED TO EAT CHEAP. Just go eat at the Station Casino with a players card or go to California Hotel or damn just go to Denny's.  Really? If you go here and enjoy the food i'm really sorry that your mouth doesn't have taste buds it has been gone long ago.JUST DOWN RIGHT STICKY I NEED A SHOWER NOW!
This place is a huge dump I got food poisoning from here. I'll never come back here again. Id soo report this place to dirty dining and health district...still avoid this at all cost...seriously!!!

So after driving past here one day my Boyfriend has been on a kick for this place.  At $5.90 (soft drinks are a bit high) how can we loose he says, ok, I say as I shuffle my feet thru the door. 

There are a lot  buffet tables so lots to choose from unfortunately not much of it is good and none of it is great. I mostly stayed with the deep fried items Chicken, Wontons had a ton of cream cheese in them, Egg Rolls, and what not.   I also had a slice of Pizza which actually had a ton of cheese real cheese on it a nice surprise.  The stuffed crabs were really good probably the best thing I had.  The soup had no flavor and the short ribs were more like beef jerky then anything.  For desert they have quite a bit of fresh fruit Oranges, Watermelon, and few other items to choose from. 

So if you are hungry for just food not good flavorful food I highly recommend it.  You really can't complain about the price of the food.  Don't get me wrong it wasn't horrible and I didn't get sick I would just prefer to eat elsewhere.
Okay selection but some food dry or no taste. Noodles very dry and no flavor looked like Spaghetti Noodles with food coloring

A great variety of Asian foods and some American plates. Fresh fruit and ice cream. Not the best sushi rolls but tasty and edible. 
Service is diligent and speedy.
We enjoyed this place because of the price amd the location. Parking is never an issue.

*** WARNING.  THIS IS A PARTIAL REVIEW.  READ AND FIND OUT WHY ***

So, after church a group of friends suggested going out for Chinese food, including dim sum, and one friend recommended Jumbo Super Buffet.  I love CHinese food, ESPECIALLY dim sum, so I thought it was a great idea.  Hardly.

When we arrived (a full hour before closing), the restaurant was half full of patrons.  There were three buffet islands of hot food and one cold island.  The buffet price is $9.89 on Sundays.  

Prior to being seated, I wanted to walk around the buffet and view the food offerings.  I wish I had my camera.  Again, with a HALF FULL restaurant, nearly every buffet hot tray was empty or contained food that appeared to have been the remains of what was set out hours ago.  My greatest fear with any buffet is that the food is old and is stirred over time after time to make it appear "fresh" again.  I understand that some food will sit longer than other selections, but I would say nearly 70% of all the food trays were empty (out of about perhaps 80 selections.  If not empty, then only old scraps remained.  I actually saw two trays with large fish heads in them, left there after customers had consumer the bodies of those fish.  It was disgusting.

Even simple dishes like rice and noodles were old, depleted and crusted on the sides of their respective trays.  And soups were down to about 25% full, with heavy crusts formed around the inside of the soup containers, with "skin" on top of the soup, created by being left there too long and not properly maintained.

Here is what drove me out of the restaurant:  the place was a health hazard!  The floors were replete with food scraps such as rice, noodles, soup drippings and other items that should be cleaned up immediately.  Only three feet from a food island was a five-gallon bucket, filled with dark water and floating food items; it was a veritable bucket of liquid swill that gave off an acrid odor.  What kind of business are these people running, anyway?

Any buffet restaurant that cannot 1) at least keep their food stocked to reasonable levels, 2) ATTEMPT to make their food items appear appetizing throughout their serving hours, and 3) maintain proper cleanliness, is destined to fail health inspections and quickly lose patrons.

When I told my friends I refused to eat there, one commented "hey, it's just food...let's eat."  Well, even dogs are fussy about their food.  I wasn't looking for a "feeding," I was looking for a meal.

As for the quality of the food that remained, I cannot comment on it.  That's why this is a partial review.  But my friends reported back that they felt ripped off and sick to their stomachs.  We should have gone to Denny's following church after all.

Bottom line:  patronize Jumbo Super Buffet at your own risk!

My family and I really like this place we go almost every other wknd. We find the food really tasty and the staff is really nice. The only thing i dont like is the restrooms it does need a new paint job. Lol

Me and my friend went here after a active day of shopping at Meadows Mall. It's the closest Asian buffet that I know of in that area. There was a big selection of hot foods. I had some crab legs, stuffed crab, shrimp, chow mien, a rib, won tons, an egg roll, and fried rice. The cream cheese won tons were my favorite. The downside is the dessert selection was lacking. They had no Lotus Balls which is my favorite! I passed on dessert because I was too full to eat it plus I didn't see anything. The meal with drinks costs around $10.00 but during the weekdays it's only $5.00. 

Downside: The bathrooms and small dessert selection

This place is $5.55 for all the food you can eat, plus a $1 or so for the drinks. That should establish the expectations right there. Having said that...

So one day my buddy and I were driving down the road and saw this place with it's "5.55 ALL DAY" sign, and we ducked in. It's the same thing we would have spent at Wendy's, we figured, so let's try it. 

Man, this place is dingy inside. But I usually don't care about that because I'm here to eat. Well, eat I did. And eat some more. The food was not amazing, but it wasn't super bad, either. I ate a ton of food for under $6, so I was happy. I can best compare the quality of the food to a Panda Express meal that's a day or two old. It's still pretty good, but it's not amazing. 

The real question behind any restaurant is if I'd go there again. With this place, I would, but only if I were starving and broke. I'm usually both of those things, actually, so I'll probably be there again sometime soon.
Went there tonight and it's closed by the health department for a fail on reinspection, GROSS
This place is discussing, when I went I saw the guy pinking his nose then serving drinks to people, the bathroom are all tagged up. And the waiter had bad people skills. I don't recommend this place.

This place follows the trend of quantity over quality, as most cheap chinese buffets do. The food is okay at best. Most of fried dishes tasted like last nights leftovers reheated in the microwave. However, they do have a variety if seafood options including: crab legs, oysters, and clams. For 9 dollars (weekend adult deal), you get a lot of value. As for the staff, they were quick and friendly. If you could look past the cleanliness of the establishment and focus on the value you receive this place is not a terrible choice.

Over all this place is good. I mean for $5.95 which is super cheap and $1.49 for a drink all you can it is a great deal the food taste great I have been coming here since 10/19/2010 when I arrived to Vegas I have never had a problem with this place.
The service is outstanding.
The waiters are very kind.
There egg fu young (how ever you spell it) is so yummy 

The only real bad thing about this place is the bathrooms. Ugh please do not go near the bathrooms other than that really good food for a super great price.

We had been craving seafood and were trying to find a cheap seafood buffet when we stumbled upon this buffet. I loved the sushi but the rice was really sticky and the rolls were huge which isn't a bad thing. My favorite thing at Chinese buffets is the homemade donuts but when my friends and I tried them they tasted fishy so we left them behind. Overall though the food was good and the price was reasonable.
No. Seriously. Do not. Go. Here. No redeeming values. I mean it. Don't go. Bland food, check. Stale desserts, check. Old and dirty interior, check.

Warning:  Do NOT eat here...unless you want diarrhea.   The restaurant smells like ammonia.  I normally don't mind a restaurant that's dirty and filthy if the food is good.  Unfortunately its not. 
 The food is suppose to be Chinese.  My mom dragged me here a few times because of its cheap price.   Price is $6 or $7 for lunch.

Ate there months ago will NEVER go back. I don't know how this place is still open. I found pieces of a roach in their sesame nut desert. They didn't even apologize. Oh and yup - they made me pay. The ladies room was disgusting. In all fairness I ate here sometime last year, started  this review, but never finished it. Diana L. glad to hear they're closed. They should stay closed.

for what it is, it gets a 3 star. the food is satisfying for the price, just stay away from the cheap sushi and some questionable looking items. i was surprised to see some authentic chinese dishes like fish tails in soy sauce and braise pigs feet. the staff were attentive enough.

Food is eh eh/okay? It's just the experience is a little bit yukky..idk maybe it's that it gets too full sometimes. Not too much seafood tho, to make up the value of the experience for me! Variety is good but not too creative, I guess. I only would go again if I had no other choices for the immediate area??? The seating is a bit too bunched up.

For all of those who complain that they expect the food to be really good well lets start off with "you get what you pay for"  I wouldn't say the food is great but its also not horrible.
Mon-fri 6.49 
Drink 1.50 free refills 
They also have pizza and salads...and ICE CREAM!!
I love egg rolls and I'm happy to say they didn't fail me here.
Also the wontons are super good 
The beef and broccoli is ok but the meat is to thick and broccoli...might as well throw in the whole bunch all together
The tofu is tasteless but at least they're giving people more options. 
They also have fish head (wtf) but its eatable and interesting.."don't see that at panda ex"
Servers here are a bit slow and can't really speak english..well it is a Chinese buffet ran by a Chinese family. Not being racist cuz I ask who the owner was.
Overall this place is good if on a budget or lunch for a group.

If you lost all your money gambling, come here to eat all you can for a $6.00 lunch so you don't starve. The price is all that this place has going for itself. Otherwise, the food is cold and bland. 

Two stars for the cheap price.

Well, the good news is, I didn't get sick from the food, and neither did any of my colleagues.  

The bad news is, it's just not remarkable in any way.  Sure, the $5.55 price tag is pretty entertaining and economical, and even with a drink, you're getting out of this place for under $10.   But our meal offerings just weren't memorable.  It just didn't sit right with me, you know?  I felt compelled to be careful what I ordered, and my Jedi instincts served me well.  But it just wasn't "Oh my God" amazing, nor did it compel me to go for seconds, or thirds.  I took the "Indiana Jones" approach and "chose wisely" for food selections, so I was fine.

Service was decent.  Nothing out of the way in terms of what we got, but it was acceptable enough to serve its needs.  

The price is great, the service was okay, the food was "meh".  I almost tried one of their many fish heads out of pure principle, but I decided that I respected my bowels too much to be that foolish.
Great place been coming here since i was 10 am 25  and now i queep coming with my children some nice staff .   the cooks always great.  Cooking.
This place sucks! Constantly running out of food and soup bowls stand around and wait not a good variety of food at all. I guess u get what u pay for.

Stopped by with my boyfriend today after saying, "It can't possibly be THAT bad."  At least not worse than I remember.  Oh no dear reader, it was much worse.  I write this review while we both lay around the house in misery bemoaning the urge to throw it all up but courting an even greater urge not to have to taste any of it ever again.

The restaurant decor is punctuated by signs telling you not to take more than you can eat so they don't have to charge more.  "They can raise the prices all they want,"  my boyfriend grunted as he pushed an unfinished plate away.  "I am NEVER coming here again!  They can't make me!"

The buffet is full of whatever they can find that wont cost them too much.  Jello,  sushi made out of cream cheese, fried rice that's not actually fried - just mixed with yellow food coloring the best we can tell.  I ate a mislabeled shrimp wrapped in what I think was a chicken patty...only the shrimp hadn't been cleaned.  The chow main was made with spaghetti noodles.  The only items were eating were the egg rolls and banana halves rolled around in strawberry syrup, which I imagine came frozen.  Everything else is either stale, old, lukewarm, under-cooked, or questionably labeled.    A tray of shrimp in sauce were labeled "Pigs Feet" and left mostly untouched by the diners.  

The last straw came when I sampled an empty cream puff.  (Though my boyfriends managed to get filling in it.)

They didn't ask us if we enjoyed our meal when we paid.

I imagine they don't really care.

"Don't worry honey,"  my boyfriend said on the ride home.  "If the spaghetti-mein was that slippery going down just think of how slippery it will be coming out."

Oh no.

I love the baked mussles, shrimps and buns and glazed nuts other than that when you come in at 8 pm 
The food is not fresh and everywhere you step is so sticky you can feel it on your shoes . Yucky ! and below the table theres like old food stickin on the floor. 
And atleast clean the buffet area and reorganize the food thats flying from pan to pan..

I enjoyed the food and the selection.  Best $6 buffet ever. 
You know going to a $6 that the meat quality is going to be a little iffy and they need to be doing something to money money. I went to the buffet and felt like I was speaking like king. The food tasted great and had a variety of different flavors. I wish I lived by so i could hit them up more often.

this place is the best the big meaty beef ribs to dim sum was the best my family loved it the prices are cheap and good or you can take some to go. this is our stop for dinner not too far from the strip. and the staff is helpful and quiet .and the seating is booth and chairs and tables.

So I been passing this place almost daily and finally gave it a go for lunch (the big $5.99 sign did me in) honestly I was expecting another below average tasteless Chinese buffet as most are...but this is NOT it, most of the food is not Americanized, the flavors are right on and by looking at other patrons...over half were Chinese for sure,..tourists, this is how I know the place is legit!
 I tried a variety of items, most were xlnt, some I didn't care for, for some reason most of the sea food was bland , however there are shining stars...the broccoli beef contained real beef, non of that mystery meat stuff, the short ribs were just xlnt, same for the wings, most of the chicken dishes were good too. there is also a selection of traditional items that I didn't venture into (fried telapia heads and such)
But its not all peaches and cream and I wouldn't expect it to be,  the fried rice was weird(how hard is it to make  decent fried rice? a monkey can do it), the aforementioned shrimp/sea food was bland, same for the hot and sour soup, thin and bland.

Overall.. cost considered, this place is the bargain of the century but SHHHH
Don't tell anyone!, it might go to the owner's head and they will raise the price...

This is not a good place to go to. I don't think Las Vegas has ANY good Chinese Buffets. I have yet to find one. Their chow menu noodles were just regular spaghetti noodles with some sort of flavoring, everything was dry and tasteless. Won't be returning here. I'll just go to the chain restaurants and enjoy their foods. Sorry.

Uhmm. I should give this more stars because it is soooo cheap, but the food was not very good.  Some of the items tasted like they were from the day before and reheated.  But it is sooooooo cheap.  The chowmein was flavorless and the noodles were undercooked.  But it is sooooo cheap.  The steamed wontons tasted like they were made with just flour and rancid water.  But it is soooooo cheap.  The softserve was too soft and overly sweet.  But it is soooo cheap.  The hispanic hostess ignored me when I got to the door and probably has a penis.  But it is soooooo cheap.

You truly get what you pay for. Granted,  I did not get sick which is why this place gets two stars instead of one. Yes, I know it's a cheap Chinese buffet which means the food will be questionable at best, but I can't resist the urge to try these out. It's kind of like an episode of Survivor only you are competing against yourself. 

Most of the food here isn't that great. Even the usual go to items like the cream cheese wontons and fried platains were questionable on my second go around of the buffet. 

Overall, I doubt I would return now that my curiosity has been satisfied.

This place is trash. We just came in as a family of 5 and got nothing but terrible service. We got an extra drink we didn't ask for added to our bill... ALL and I mean ALL the food was dried out and old. My son wanted a California roll and they never came back out with a new plate. The Egg Drop Soup had a jelly like consistency and when we brought up our complaints no one did anything to fix it. I suggest any other buffet but this one.

I used to drive past this restaurant practically every day when I first moved to LV, but never tried Jumbo Super Buffet.  Recently I saw their ad in the local Chinese newspaper advertising $5.55 all day buffet ($7.61 is what you will pay if you also order a drink + whatever you leave as tip), and was curious what kind of food they would be serving you for about what you would pay for a combo meal at McDonalds, Jack In the Box, etc.

Recently on a day that I was feeling particularly adventurous, fearless or extra foolish, I decided what the heck, let's give it a try.

The parking lot was fairly full when I drove up.  A positive sign that they are at least getting the customers from their niche market, which I would say are the senior citizens, families with a lot of kids, and pretty much lower income families and individuals, or those that are on a tight budget.

The restaurant iself is defintiely older looking.  They did not spend much to decorate the interior or the exterior of the restaurant, but they do have a small army of waiters/bussers that work there that is very good at cleaning up after the guests leave and picking up the used plates during the course of your meal.

About the food. The dim sum which I was hoping will be good is rather disappointing for me.  I didn't touch their sushi selection, as I am not sure how long things were left out.  They do have a lot of soups (hot & sour, egg drop, etc), although I didn't give any of them a try. And the more traditional Chinese selections (e.g., Beef and Broccoli) is decent for the price. The American entree items, like beef ribs tend to be way overcooked and greasy. The cut fruits is probbly the best part of their otherwise disappointing dessert selections (which I was expecting from having read the other Yelp reviews posted), but as far as the number of dessert slections it is a fair amount if you combine both the Chinese desserts with the American ones.

Overall, I felt that the food tends to be overcooked and on the salty side (salty = more thirsty customer = drink more sodas and therefor eat less food).  But it is hard to complain about the food considering how much you are paying.

I would not say that this is a crappy restaurant for the price, as you get pretty much what you pay for.  The food is not top quality by any means, but what attracts the patrons that frequent this restaurant is their low price.  Jumbo Super Buffet is never going to be voted The Best of Las vegas, but they serve a niche market for those with a tight budget.

Compared to other Chinese AYCE buffets I have tried in the LV area, this is not one of best ones, but the price you pay is the lowest too.  So if you want better food and willing to pay more, by all means check out the other AYCE Asian Buffets in the area, otherwise Jumbo Super Buffet is adequate as a restaurant for those looking to fill an empty tummy with the least amount of cash expenditures.

3 stars.
It is a really good buffet no expensive at all food is good and love coming here love the Shrimp and customer service !!!! I think everyone should come!!!!!
